page.title: 03THURLBY 1945.
page.content: In 1945 our school secretary was 11 years old.The school had 90 pupils in 4 classrooms.They were very strict.If you were late for school you would get the cane.You were hardly allowed to move!There were no school dinners. There were about 700 people in the village. The houses were small.Some had ladders to get upstairs.Few had bathrooms and many had to get all the water from standpipes in the street. There were 4 shops and a butcher,baker coalman and milkman.He had his own cows and took the milk round in cans and people brought jugs to the door. A lot of people kept chickens and a pig.The pig was fed on scraps.It was killed by the butcher and was then salted.It would keep for a year.There were 3 Pubs and 2 Chapels and a Black- smith.There were hardly any cars or bikes.24 aniseed balls cost a H'penny.
